198.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a life-time hunting license for nonresidents who are sixty-five years or older and who own real property in the state. The bill grants the Director of the Division of Natural Resources rule-making authority. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

199.title: Exempting motorcycles from the requirement of annual registration
199.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the registration of motorcycles for twenty-four months.

200.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
200.title: Relating to drug and alcohol free mines
200.description: Relating to drug and alcohol free mines

201.title: Providing for removal and election of Public Service Commissioners
201.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the election and removal of public service commissioners, setting terms of office for said commissioners,   and otherwise relating to the Public Service Commission.

202.title: Adding a special memorial day to celebrate the victory of democracy in the Cold War
202.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to West Virginia Code §2-2-1a to provide for an additional special memorial day to celebrate the victory of democracy in the Cold War.

203.title: Relating to requirements for self-employed persons to participate in the Bureau of Child Support Enforcement's PayConnextion program
203.description: The purpose of this bill is to require self-employed persons to participate in the Bureau of Child Support Enforcement's Pay Connexion program.  This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

204.title: Requiring color coded certificates of insurance to be placed on the windshield of the insured motor vehicle
204.description: The purpose of this bill is to require color coded certificates of insurance to be placed on the windshield of the insured motor vehicle and to provide penalties for violations of this section.

205.title: Prohibiting discrimination in rates by insurance companies because of having filed claims under the uninsured and under insured coverage of an automobile policy
205.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit discrimination in rates by insurance companies because of claims filed under the uninsured and under insured coverage of an automobile insurance policy. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

206.title: Providing that accident report forms are conclusive as to the issue of the accident's cause, unless a court rules otherwise
206.description: The purpose of this bill is to  provide that a completed crash report form is conclusive upon the issue as to causation unless a court of competent jurisdiction rules otherwise.

207.title: Providing for actual costs to be paid for municipal audits and reducing the cap on audits for Class IV municipalities
207.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for actual costs to be paid for municipal audits and reduces the cap on audits to $1,000 for Class IV municipalities.

208.title: Requiring that all worker's compensation adjusters employed by a private insurance carrier be located within the geographic borders of West Virginia
208.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve claimants' access to workers' compensation adjusters by requiring that all workers' compensation adjusters employed by a private insurance carrier be located within the geographic borders of West Virginia.

209.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
209.title: Small Business Development Incentive Program for Internal Growth Act
209.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the "Small Business Development Incentive Program for Internal Growth Act." The bill exempts certain small businesses from paying business- related taxes if they qualify as start up businesses with limited resources.

210.title: Providing county boards of education may study the economic feasibility of exercising an option of engaging in cooperative agreements with local public or regional transit authorities to transport students
210.description: The purpose of this bill is to  provide that county boards of education may, in cooperation with local public or regional transit authorities study the feasibility of entering into cooperative agreements to transport students to and from school. The bill also requires that county boards submit proposed cooperative agreements to the Department of Transportation for approval prior to implementation. In addition, the bill requires county boards to submit reports to the Legislatures' Joint Committee on Government and Finance on the cost-effectiveness of cooperative agreements that have been implemented. Under the bill, the Secretary of Transportation is required to propose legislative rules to be used as guidelines for approval of proposed cooperative agreements.

211.title: Permitting deed of trust or mortgage interest paid on a taxpayers' personal residences to be used for personal income tax purposes
211.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit deed of trust or mortgage interest paid on taxpayers' personal residences to be used as a deduction for personal income tax purposes up to $4,000 per year.

212.title: Requiring notice of an abortion to be provided to the father of the unborn child
212.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that a woman contemplating an abortion provide the name of the father to the physician, clinic or medical facility performing the abortion and to require the physician, clinic or medical facility to notify the father of the proposed abortion. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

213.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
213.title: Relating to the "Mandated Benefits Review Act"
213.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Insurance Commissioner to review and report to the Legislature in an actuarially-based fashion the financial and other related impacts of any proposed legislation to mandate medical or health-related benefits.

214.title: Exempting undergraduate students attending state colleges or universities for the first two years postgraduation, from the payment of state income tax
214.description: The purpose of this bill is to give current undergraduate students relief from paying state income taxes and graduates of undergraduate programs relief from state income taxes for a period of two years. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

215.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
215.title: Prohibiting family planning centers that receive state funding from discussing abortion
215.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit family planning centers in West Virginia that receive state funding from discussing abortion or abortion referrals.

216.title: Allowing certain county boards of education to operate their schools on a four-day school week
216.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow county boards of education in low density counties to operate their schools on a four-day school week basis.

217.title: Subtracting social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income
217.description: The purpose of this bill is to subtract social security benefits from federal adjusted gross income to determine West Virginia adjusted gross income for purposes of personal income tax.

218.title: Verifiable Science Act
218.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the public may request and shall receive, access under the state Freedom of Information Act to any purported scientific data used as the basis for proposed legislative rules or statutory enactments. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

219.title: Consolidating purchasing by county boards of education
219.description: The purpose of this bill is to consolidate purchasing by county boards of education through the regional education service agency serving their area.

220.title: Providing nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education
220.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide nonsupervisory employees of the West Virginia State Board of Education with the same protections against summary dismissal as are applicable to employees of county boards of education through continuing contracts and dismissal for cause. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

221.title: Prohibiting the use of touch screen voting machines
221.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of electronic voting technology that employs "touch screens" or requires the voter to touch a screen with a stylus to cast a vote.

222.title: Providing correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service
222.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that correctional officers may retire with full benefits after twenty years of actual and honorable service.

223.title: Notifying persons from out-of-state who issue worthless checks in this state and who, fail to pay the check and applicable fine or fail to appear in court, that a notice of their failure will be sent to the Division of Motor Vehicles
223.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a process for notifying persons residing out-of-state who write worthless checks in this state, and who after being served with a summons upon a worthless check complaint fail to pay the check and applicable fine or fail to make an appearance in magistrate court, that the Division of Motor Vehicles will be notified of their failure, to be dealt with in accordance with existing law.

224.title: Providing that when a person from another state writes a worthless check in this state which results in a summons to appear in magistrate court but then fails to appear shall have his or her privilege to drive in this state revoked
224.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that when a person from another state writes a worthless check in this state which results in a summons to appear in magistrate court but then fails to appear, the person shall have his or her privilege to drive in this state revoked. The bill also provides that the Division of Motor Vehicles mail notice of the revocation to the state wherein the person who wrote the bad check holds a driver's license.

225.title: Requiring the DMV to notify the state police when a registered sex offender purchases, trades or registers a motor vehicle
225.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Division of Motor Vehicles to notify the West Virginia State Police when a registered sex offender purchases, trades or registers a motor vehicle.

226.title: Requiring background checks on applicants for residence in nursing homes and assisted living residences
226.description: The purpose of this bill is to require background checks on applicants for residence in nursing homes and assisted living residences; and to provide for special arrangements for applicants who are sex offenders or certain convicted felons.

227.title: Providing that a county commission may establish a program for transfer of development rights without the requirement for an election
227.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a county commission may establish a program for transfer of development rights without the requirement for an election on an ordinance for the program.

228.title: Limiting the purchase of handguns to one gun per month
228.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit the purchase of handguns to two guns per month. The bill exempts law enforcement, correctional facilities, and private security companies from the limitation while providing criminal penalties. Finally, it exempts antique firearms from the limitation. §61-7-16 is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

229.title: Prohibiting the demolition of a historic structure prior to a review of and the issuance of a permit by the Commissioner of the Division of Culture and History
229.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the demolition of a historic structure prior to a review of and the issuance of a permit for the undertaking by the Commissioner of the Division of Culture and History.

230.title: Authorizing county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income
230.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize county commissions to use impact fees to fund the building and operation of libraries and to administer and provide affordable housing for individuals or families of low or moderate income.  §7-20-3a is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

231.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
231.title: Removing the exemption from planning and zoning restrictions for mining and manufacturing activities and uses
231.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the zoning exemption regarding existing uses for mining and manufacturing activities.

232.title: Providing that actions in which the state is a party be brought in the county which is affected or related to the controversy
232.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the requirement that venue properly lies in Kanawha County in relation to certain controversies involving the state.

233.title: Providing a procedure for disclosure of birth parents to an adoptee, in certain circumstances
233.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a procedure for disclosure of birth parents to an adoptee, when the parties are not registered in the voluntary adoption registry.

234.title: Providing an election to allow resident homeowners, sixty-five years old or older, to defer the payment of property tax increases to their residential property
234.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit county commissions to allow resident homeowners, who are sixty-five years or older, to defer the payment of property tax increases to their residential property during their lifetime.

235.title: Exempting antique cars from taxation and fees
235.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt antique cars from taxation and fees.

236.title: West Virginia Child Advocate for the Protection of Children Act
236.description: The purpose of this bill is add language to West Virginia Code to provide a child advocate for the protection of children. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

237.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
237.title: Relating to towing companies notifying the DMV of abandoned vehicles
237.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow towing companies to notify the DMV of abandoned vehicles that have been towed and for the DMV to levy a penalty against the owner of the abandoned vehicle if the fees for towing are not paid in full.

238.title: Increasing the minimum prison sentence for a parent or guardian or custodian who abuses a child
238.description: The purpose of this bill increases the minimum prison sentence from two years to five years without the possibility of parole for a parent, guardian or custodian who abuses a child that results serious bodily injury.

239.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
239.title: Adding Tramadol to Schedule IV of the West Virginia Uniform Controlled Substances Act
239.description: The purpose of this bill is to add Tramadol to Schedule IV of the West Virginia Uniform Controlled Substances Act.

240.title: Relating to the conversion of other financial institutions to state-chartered banks
240.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit any bank, thrift or credit union organized under the laws of the United States or any other state to use this article to effect a conversion to a state-chartered bank.

241.title: Permitting running lamps on motorcycles, motor-driven cycles and mopeds
241.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit running lamps on motorcycles, motor-driven cycles and mopeds.

242.title: Requiring disclosure by judicial officers of campaign contributions in excess of $250
242.description: The purpose of this bill is to require disclosure by judicial officers of campaign contributions in excess of $250. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

243.title: Changing the board members of public service districts terms from six years to three years
243.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the term of board members of public service districts from six years to three years.

244.title: Specifying that federal civil service system retirement income derived from military retirement system pensions that have been converted to federal civil service system pensions is treated as military retirement income for purposes of the modificatio
244.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the West Virginia personal income tax to cause federal civil service system pension income derived from military retirement system pensions that have been converted into federal civil service system pensions to have the same decreasing modification treatment as military retirement system income. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

245.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
245.title: Repealing article of the code granting a business license to sell drug paraphernalia
245.description: The purpose of this bill is to repeal provisions which allow a business to acquire a license to sell drug paraphernalia. This eliminates a conflict within the code.

246.title: Creating the Martinsburg-Berkeley County Public Library, creating a library board with the power to operate said library, and providing a method of financing the operation of the library
246.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the Martinsburg Public Library to the Martinsburg-Berkeley County Public Library. Also, to create a library board with the power to operate the public library. Finally, to provide a stable method of financing the operation of the Martinsburg-Berkeley County Public Library.

247.title: Expanding the list of federal law-enforcement officers who are extended the authority of state and local law-enforcement officers to enforce the laws of this state
247.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs and special agents within the Office of Inspector General to carry firearms while performing their duties.

248.title: Prohibiting the use of calculators for teaching purposes in grades K through eight
248.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the student use of calculators for teaching purposes in grades K through eight. The bill permits calculators to be used by educators in furtherance of their instructional responsibilities. This secton is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

249.title: Requiring regional airport authority board members to include persons of area expertise
249.description: The purpose of this bill is to require regional airport authority board members to include persons of area expertise.

250.title: Increasing the salaries of magistrates who serve populations of eight thousand four hundred or more
250.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase salaries of magistrates who serve populations of eight thousand four hundred or more to sixty percent of the salary of circuit court judges after July 1, 2011.

251.title: Limiting liability for persons donating and charitable organizations accepting certain food and grocery items
251.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt persons and nonprofit organizations from civil and criminal liability when donating or receiving certain food items. The bill does not exempt liability for gross negligence or intentional misconduct.

252.title: Providing additional state minimum salary for certain teachers
252.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an additional $5,000 in state minimum salary to fully certified math and science teachers who teach in these subjects in grades seven through twelve and to certified reading specialists.

253.title: Authorizing excess funds in the courtesy Patrol Fund to be transferred back to the Tourism Promotion Fund
253.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize excess funds in the Courtesy Patrol Fund to be transferred back to the Tourism Promotion Fund.

254.title: Allowing persons involved in motor vehicle accidents to receive pertinent information at no charge in order to file a timely insurance claim
254.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow persons involved in motor vehicle accidents to receive pertinent information at no charge in order to file a timely insurance claim. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

255.title: Relating to approval of a student for homebound services and their rights
255.description: The purpose of the bill is to enable homebound students to continue their education without having to be approved every nine weeks and to enable homebound students to progress in school at the same rate as regular students.

256.title: Authorizing and encouraging county boards of education to share services of central office administrative personnel
256.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize and encourage county boards of education to share services of central office administrative personnel and to obtain these services from regional education service agencies.

257.title: Eliminating the severance tax and the health care provider tax on behavior health providers
257.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the severance tax and health care provider tax on behavior health providers.

258.title: Extending unemployment compensation benefits when special circumstances exist
258.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the Governor authority to grant an extension for unemployment compensation benefits when special economic circumstances exist.

259.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
259.title: Establishing the consumer's right to know regarding telemarketers and requiring certain vendors to use only persons authorized to work in the United States
259.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the consumer's right to know regarding telemarketers; to require certain vendors to use only persons authorized to work in the United States; to establish customer's right to know a customer sales or customer service call center information; and providing a penalty. These sections are new; therefore, they have been completely underscored.

260.title: Changing the amount a person can earn while receiving unemployment benefits
260.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the amount a person can earn while receiving unemployment compensation benefits, without it changing the benefits received, from $60 a week to forty percent of the person's weekly benefit rate.

261.title: Allowing for an adjusted gross income of a taxpayer for contributions to the maintenance and improvement of state, county and municipal parks
261.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for a reduction in the adjusted gross income of a taxpayer for contributions to the maintenance and improvement of state, county and municipal parks.

262.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
262.title: Requiring the Office of Miners Health and Safety to employ qualified diesel inspectors
262.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Office of Miners Health and Safety to employ qualified diesel inspectors.

263.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
263.title: Requiring employers to pay nurses at their regular rate of pay for all the time they are on-call on the employer's premises
263.description: The purpose of this bill is to require   employers to pay nurses at their regular rate of pay for all the time they are on- call on the employer's premises.

264.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
264.title: Making the use of permanent replacements for striking workers an unfair labor practice in certain instances
264.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the use of permanent replacements for striking workers an unfair labor practice by employers who have employee stock ownership plans.

265.title: Requiring the State Board of Education to promulgate rule implementing a tornado safety awareness plan in public schools
265.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the state Board of Education to implement a tornado safety awareness plan in public schools.   §18-2-5h   is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

266.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
266.title: Requiring the superintendent or owner of a mine to sign the fire boss record book daily
266.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the superintendent or owner-operator of the mine to sign the fire boss record book each day along with the mine foreman.

267.title: Providing a ten percent discount to residents at state parks and forests
267.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a ten percent discount to West Virginia residents for lodging, camping and other recreation activities at state parks and forests.

268.title: Giving the Insurance Commissioner the power to regulate and penalize self-insured employers
268.description: The purpose of this bill is to give the Insurance Commissioner the power to regulate and penalize self-insured employers in order to combat the practice of employers neglecting to pay benefits offered under their self-insured plans, resulting in unpaid medical bills which negatively impacts employees' credit ratings.

269.title: Relating to assessments of real property
269.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit increases in the assessed value of real property which is located in a county where a maximum excess levy is in effect, the property has not changed in tax classification and the increased value is more than two percent over the assessed value of the same property for the previous year.

270.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
270.title: Business and occupation tax credit to electric power generators for the use of West Virginia coal
270.description: Business and occupation tax credit to electric power generators for the use of West Virginia coal

271.title: Increasing compensation of membership of the West Virginia State Police
271.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase compensation for members of the West Virginia State Police.

272.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
272.title: Requiring paramedics to be on site at coal mines
272.description: The purpose of this bill is to require paramedics to be on site at coal mines.

273.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
273.title: Income tax exemption for veterans who locate in West Virginia following separation from service
273.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt from state income tax, for five years, veterans and their spouses who locate in the state following separation from military service.

274.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
274.title: Requiring abortion facilities to have certain written policies and procedures
274.description: Requiring abortion facilities to have certain written policies and procedures

275.title: Providing a three percent cap on any increase in assessment on real property that is the primary residence
275.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a three percent cap on any increase in assessment on real property that is the primary residence of an individual in any one year.

276.title: Relating to minimum grab bar standards for hotel and motel rooms that are specifically designated or intended for use by handicapped or disabled guests
276.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the maintenance of sufficient grab bars in hotel and motel rooms which have been set aside or designated to serve the needs of disabled patrons, to reduce the prospect of injury caused by falls in tubs and showers. §16-6-14a is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

277.title: Authorizing the use of additional medium for use in archiving government records
277.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the use of additional medium for use in archiving government records.

278.title: Requiring that abortion providers notify the parents of a minor seeking an abortion forty-eight hours before performing the procedure
278.description: The purpose of this bill is to require forty-eight hours notice to the parents of a minor seeking an abortion before performing the abortion. Current law requires a twenty-four hour notice.

279.title: Relating to redemption or repayment of PROMISE scholarship funds when a student drops or withdraws from classes
279.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant the Higher Education Policy Commission rule-making authority to redeem or secure repayment of PROMISE Scholarship Funds from students who withdraw or drop classes. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

280.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
280.title: Establishing the crime of partial birth infanticide
280.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the felony crime of partial birth infanticide. This section has been completely rewritten; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

281.title: Eliminating fees charged by the Criminal Identification Bureau to the State Police for providing certain information to volunteer fire departments
281.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate fees charged by the Criminal Identification Bureau of the West Virginia State Police for providing certain information to volunteer fire departments.

282.title: Granting public employees credit toward their West Virginia public employee retirement benefits for service in the Peace Corps
282.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant Peace Corps members credited service toward the West Virginia public employees retirement benefits, even if they are not public employees at the time of their service. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

283.title: Authorizing the issuance of special license plates for pharmacists
283.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the issuance of special license plates for pharmacists.

284.title: Directing the State Board of Education to determine what principal and teacher reports are unnecessary
284.description: The purpose of this bill is to direct the State Board of Education to determine what principal and teacher reports are unnecessary; and to require the state board to identify these reports to the Legislature with recommendations on how to alleviate the administrative burden of these reports on principals and teachers. This section has been completely rewritten; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

285.title: Providing discounted motor registration fees for members of volunteer fire departments
285.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a discounted motor vehicle registration fee to members of volunteer fire departments. Members would receive two years' motor vehicle registration upon payment of a one-year registration fee.

286.title: Abolishing joint liability and establishing the principle of comparative fault
286.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish joint liability and establish the principle of comparative fault by which each defendant is liable for damages according to the percentage of fault attributed by a judge or jury. §§55-7-13a, 13b and 13c are new; therefore, they have been completely underscored.

287.title: Decreasing the corporate income tax rate beginning in the year 2012
287.description: The purpose of this bill is to decrease the corporate income tax rate beginning in the year 2012 by eliminating the higher tax rate should the combined balance in the Revenue Fund Shortfall Reserve Fund and the Revenue Fund Shortfall Reserve Fund - Part B not equal or exceed ten percent of the General Revenue Fund.

288.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
288.title: Abortion Complication Reporting Act
288.description: The purpose of this bill is to require physicians to file regular reports with the Department of Health and Human Resources, regarding patients who require medical treatment as a result of an abortion; providing criminal penalties for violation. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

289.title: Uniform Premarital Agreement Act
289.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Uniform Premarital Agreement Act. This act allows parties to a marriage to contract prior to marriage with respect to property rights, actions to be taken upon dissolution of the marriage, rights to insurance proceeds upon death of either party, choice of controlling law and any other matters not in violation of criminal statutes or public policy. Child support cannot be adversely affected.  This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

290.title: Providing that identity theft is a felony if a person commits the crime with the intent to commit any other crime
290.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the crime of identity theft to provide that it is a felony if a person commits the crime with the intent to commit any other crime. Current statutory language limits the felony to persons who commit the crime with the intent to fraudulently represent themselves as another person for purposes of making credit or financial transactions.

291.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
291.title: Requiring the DHHR to annually review and adjust rates it pays to care providers
291.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Department of Health and Human Resources to annually review and adjust rates it pays to care providers to be comparable, on percentage basis, to rates paid to hospitals. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

292.title: Prohibiting the publication of the consideration paid for the sale of real estate or the amount of any lien on the real property subject to the sale
292.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the publication of the consideration paid for the sale of real estate or the amount of any lien on the real property subject to the sale.

293.title: Imposing an excise tax on the sale or rental of obscene materials
293.description: The purpose of this bill is to produce revenue by imposition of a tax upon the sale or rental of obscene materials. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

294.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
294.title: Requiring that abortions be performed in hospitals or by physicians with admitting privileges to a hospital within the local service area
294.description: Requiring that abortions be performed in hospitals or by physicians with admitting privileges to a hospital within the local service area

295.title: Income tax deduction for gifts to West Virginia charities
295.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit deductions from federal adjusted gross income, for personal income tax purposes, for contributions to religious, educational or charitable organizations.

296.title: Requiring lobbyists to disclose compensation agreements for each registered employer
296.description: The purpose of this bill is to require lobbyists to disclose compensation agreements for each registered employer.

297.title: Prohibiting any member of the Legislature from fund-raising during any session
297.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit members of the Legislature from fund-raising during any session of the Legislature.

298.title: Eliminating parole for persons incarcerated in state correctional facilities
298.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate parole for persons incarcerated in state correctional facilities.

299.title: Abolishing the one-vote straight ticket voting in all general and special elections within West Virginia
299.description: This bill shall abolish the one-vote straight-ticket voting in all general and special elections within West Virginia.

300.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
300.title: Ending the requirement that health facilities acquire a certificate of need to open
300.description: The purpose of this bill is to end the requirement that health facilities acquire a certificate of need to open.

301.title: Providing an annual $5,000 bonus to teachers of advanced placement math and science classes
301.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an annual $5,000 bonus to teachers of advanced placement math and science classes.

302.title: Altering apportionment of the membership of the House of Delegates by adding a 59th delegate district consisting of portions of Mason and Putnam counties
302.description: The purpose of this bill is to alter apportionment of the membership of the House of Delegates by adding a 59th delegate district consisting of portions of Mason and Putnam counties.

303.title: Relating to the employment and compensation of school service personnel
303.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify when aides should be considered supervisory employees for purposes of receiving pay at a higher pay grade and to provide that classroom aides in kindergarten classrooms which have more pupils than the maximum pupil/teacher ratio receive additional compensation as to professional personnel in said classrooms The bill also creates two new positions for bus drivers and establishes a pay grade for those positions.

304.title: Providing misdemeanor criminal penalty for failing to comply with law regarding sale, lease or disposition of municipal property
304.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide misdemeanor criminal penalty for failing to comply with law regarding sale, lease or disposition of municipal property. The penalty includes automatic removal from office.

305.title: Relating to the Office of Consumer Advocacy, and allowing the Director to participate in the review and consideration of any rate filing
305.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the director to participate in the review and consideration of any rate filing made pursuant to chapter thirty-three.

306.title: Relating to the worker's compensation claimant attorney fees
306.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the way fees are awarded to attorney's in workers' compensation claims.

307.title: Protecting computer owners and users from computer spyware
307.description: The purpose of this bill provides protection for computer owners and users from deceptive or otherwise unauthorized spyware including civil remedies and authorization for the Attorney General to receive and act on complaints of owners and users.

308.title: Requiring the use of helmets by skateboarders
308.description: Requiring the use of helmets by skateboarders

309.title: Establishing a program for reprogramming cellular telephones and distributing to seniors for making emergency calls
309.description: Establishing a program for reprogramming cellular telephones and distributing to seniors for making emergency calls

310.title: Creating the criminal offense of injury to a pregnant woman that results in miscarriage or stillbirth
310.description: Creating the criminal offense of injury to a pregnant woman that results in miscarriage or stillbirth

311.title: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Division of Veterans' Affairs
311.description: Making a supplementary appropriation to the Division of Veterans' Affairs

312.title: Relating to the insertion of language which defines acts of violence and makes its false reporting a felony
312.description: The purpose of this bill is to define "acts of violence" and making the false reporting of an act of violence a felony.

313.title: Allowing for juveniles to be tried as adults for instances of child abuse resulting in bodily injury and child abuse which results in death
313.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow for juveniles to be tried as adults for instances of child abuse resulting in bodily injury and child abuse which results in death.

314.title: Relating to obscene, anonymous, harassing and threatening communications by computer
314.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a third or subsequent offense under this section is a felony and, provide penalties of imprisonment for not more than two years, a fine of not more than $5,000, or both.

315.title: Giving full consideration to bicycle, pedestrian and transit ways in the planning, development of state roads, railways and waterways
315.description: The purpose of this bill is to include bicycle, pedestrian and transit ways in consideration in the planning, development and redevelopment of state roads, railways and waterways. It provides that bicycle, pedestrian and transit ways shall be established in conjunction with the construction, reconstruction or other changes of any state road, rail bed or transit way, with special emphasis to projects in or within five miles of an urban area or rural municipality. §17-4-36a is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

316.title: Redefining planning periods for teachers
316.description: The purpose of this bill is to redefine planning periods for teachers.

317.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
317.title: Requiring that permanent and temporary battery charging stations in mines be ventilated directly to the return on a separate split of air
317.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that permanent and temporary battery charging stations in mines be ventilated directly to the return on a separate split of air.

318.title: Prohibiting the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings
318.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of a credit score in casualty insurance rate filings.

319.title: Exempting Division of Natural Resources conservation officers' retirement pensions from state income tax
319.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt Division of Natural Resources conservation officers' retirement pensions from state income tax law.

320.title: Giving teachers credit toward the pay scale for completing an accredited seminary
320.description: The purpose of this bill is to give teachers credit toward the pay scale for completing an accredited seminary.

321.title: Creating and issuing certificates recognizing the termination of marriage
321.description: Creating and issuing certificates recognizing the termination of marriage

322.title: The Family Education Tax Credit Act
322.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a tax credit program for individuals paying qualified educational expenses and for those individuals or corporations making donations to organizations granting scholarships for qualified educational expenses. The bill defines terms and sets forth requirements. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

324.title: Using both parents' income in determining child support, calculation of adjusted gross income
324.description: Using both parents' income in determining child support, calculation of adjusted gross income

325.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
325.title: Reporting requirements when it is suspected that a woman suffered injury or death due to induced abortion
325.description: The purpose of this bill is to require physicians to report to the Department of Health and Human Resources when he or she believes that a woman has suffered injury or death due to an induced abortion, to impose duties on the Department of Health and Human Resources regarding these reports and to outline penalties for violations. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

326.title: Authorizing the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue a limited number of license plates to County Prosecutors for use on vehicles
326.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles to issue a limited number of license plates to county prosecutors for use on vehicles used by investigators to conduct undercover operations.

327.title: Providing for a Public Service Commission investigation for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission
327.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a Public Service Commission investigator for traffic accidents involving a motor carrier regulated by the Public Service Commission and in which an individual suffers severe bodily injury or death.

328.title: Reimbursing teachers for recertification fees
328.description: The purpose of the bill is to reimburse teachers for recertification with the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards.

329.title: Relating to the licensing of private investigators and security guards
329.description: The purpose of this bill is to strengthen enforcement in the private investigating and security guard field by revising the current law governing the licensing of private investigators and security guards. It modifies the licensing of private investigators and security guards, with exceptions for federal officers, provides for the registration of private investigative and security guard employees, and provides penalties for late registration and fees and charges for services of the Secretary of State.

330.title: Providing that certain mental hygiene commissioners are eligible for membership in the Public Employees Retirement System
330.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that certain mental hygiene commissioners are eligible for membership in the Public Employees Retirement System.

331.title: Providing a loan forgiveness program for nurses
331.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a loan forgiveness program for nurses similar to what currently exists for medical doctors and osteopathic physicians. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

332.title: Allowing the purchase of service credit in the State Teachers Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)
332.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the purchase of service credit in the state Teachers' Retirement System for temporary employment under the Comprehensive Employment and Training Act (CETA)and to specify the cost of the service credit purchased.

333.title: Allowing teachers who graduated from colleges and universities that are not accredited by associations recognized in West Virginia, to obtain a teaching certificate based on their certification in another state
333.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow teachers who graduated from colleges and universities that are not accredited by associations recognized in West Virginia, to obtain a teaching certificate based on their certification in another state of at least ten years.

334.title: Allowing mental hygiene commissioners to carry concealed weapons
334.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow Mental Hygiene Commissioners to carry concealed weapons.

335.title: Providing limited immunity from civil damages for persons who volunteer their services to public health departments
335.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide immunity from civil damages for persons who volunteer their services to a Public Health Department. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

336.title: Eliminating West Virginia income tax on social security benefits
336.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate West Virginia income tax on social security benefits.

338.title: Including enforcement officers employed by the Alcohol and Beverage Control Commission in the classified service under the Civil Service System
338.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that enforcement officers employed by the office of West Virginia Alcohol Beverage Control Commissioner be included in the classified service under the Civil Service System.

339.title: Relating to issuance of renewal license certificate to motor vehicle dealers
339.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide situations when renewal license certificate to motor vehicle dealers may be issued to dealers who sell less than eighteen vehicles in a year.

340.title: Relating to meeting and conference rights for members of police or fire departments employed by political subdivisions
340.description: Relating to meeting and conference rights for members of police or fire departments employed by political subdivisions

341.title: Providing that municipal employees may receive up to two years of retirement service credit for military service
341.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that municipal employees may receive up to two years of retirement service credit for military service prior to, or during, their municipal employment.

342.title: Requiring the West Virginia Commissioner of Highways to use recycled materials in construction or maintenance of roads and highways
342.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Commissioner of Highways to use recycled materials in construction or maintenance of roads and highways.

343.title: Removing the receipt of an annuity, pension or other retirement pay as a disqualification for unemployment compensation benefits
343.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the receipt of an annuity, pension or other retirement pay as a disqualification for unemployment compensation benefits.

344.title: Changing the membership of the PEIA Financial Board
344.description: The purpose of this bill is to change the membership of the PEIA Financial Board by changing the number of citizen members from four to three, and requiring the position of the former citizen member be taken by a person who is an interested person from a participating political subdivision.

345.title: Reconciling code provisions relating to law enforcement officers duties to enforce domestic violence protective orders
345.description: The purpose of this bill is to resolve a conflict in criminal statutes. Last year, the Legislature passed House Bill No. 2739 which authorized law-enforcement officers to seize any weapons in the respondent's possession at the time the officer serves the respondent with the order. Further, House Bill No. 2739 made the possession of a firearm by a respondent a criminal offense after an emergency protective order issued and before a hearing. This bill clarifies that law-enforcement may remove weapons possessed after service or notice but before an actual hearing.

346.title: Extending the maximum length of protective orders in domestic violence
346.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the maximum length of protective orders in domestic violence cases from one hundred eighty days to one year.

347.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
347.title: Requiring the Blanchette Rockefeller Neurosciences Institute to develop a plan regarding neurodegenerative diseases
347.description: The purpose of this bill is to position the state to be the national leader in research and development of treatments for neurodegenerative diseases. Implementation is intended to benefit the health of our citizens, improve the economy and further academic excellence in the State of West Virginia. §18B-14-12   is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

348.title: Establishing a funding source and programs for persons with traumatic brain injury
348.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a funding source and programs for persons with traumatic brain injury.

349.title: Providing that a legally unlicensed personal care home may house up to four unrelated residents if there is at least one full-time employee working at the home
349.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that a legally unlicensed personal care home may house up to four unrelated residents if there is at least one full-time employee working at the home.

350.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
350.title: Relating to issuing a certificate of birth resulting in stillbirth
350.description: The purpose of "Kirstin's bill" is to provide for the issuance by the State Registrar of a Certificate of Birth Resulting in Stillbirth to parents of a stillborn who request the record to be prepared.

351.title: Extending the alternative-fuel motor vehicle tax credit for ten years and making the credit retroactive from the expiration date of the initial credit
351.description: The purpose of this bill is to extend the alternative- fuel motor vehicles tax credit for ten years and to make the credit retroactive from the expiration date of the initial credit.

352.title: Allowing the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a "School Choice Zone"
352.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow the State Superintendent of Schools to designate certain geographical areas as a School Choice Zone which would enable students residing in the designated area to attend school in a neighboring county if they wish.

353.title: Giving local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel in its jurisdiction
353.description: The purpose of this bill is to give local authorities the authority to decrease the speed limit on streets and highways where school buses travel.

354.title: Allowing state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conference for their children
354.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow state employees to take paid leave to attend parent-teacher conferences for their children. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

355.title: Requiring county boards of education to employ a certified library media specialist in each county school
355.description: Requiring county boards of education to employ a certified library media specialist in each county school

356.title: Issuing a special "Family of an Officer Killed in the Line of Duty" license plate
356.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the issuance of a special "Family of an Officer Killed in the Line of Duty" license plate and assessing a special initial application fee and a special annual fee for the special license plate.

357.title: Allowing certain public employees to pay back retirement benefits
357.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow public employees with fifteen or more years' service who were subject to reduction in force layoffs to pay back retirement benefits they cashed out of the Public Employees Retirement System.

358.title: Increasing benefits of retired state personnel and retired teachers
358.description: Increasing benefits of retired state personnel and retired teachers

359.title: Allowing quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes
359.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow quarterly payment of real and personal property taxes.

360.title: Limiting liability for repair costs to automobile owners when they hit a deer on a public highway
360.description: The purpose of this bill is to limit costs to automobile owners for repairs needed when they hit a deer on a public highway.

361.title: Increasing penalties for financial exploitation of an elderly person or incapacitated adult
361.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the penalties for the financial exploitation of elderly persons and incapacitated adults.

362.title: Preventing a reduction in the annuity of a person who retires with disability retirement at age sixty-five
362.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent a reduction in the annuity of a person who retires with disability retirement at age sixty-five.

363.title: Reducing state income tax liability for certain retired public employees
363.description: The purpose of this bill is to reduce state income tax liability for certain retired public employees and increase the amount of retirement income received from certain state and federal retirement systems that is excluded from the calculation of income subject to state personal income taxes.

364.title: Preventing a professional educator from taking a coaching position away from a current coach
364.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent a professional educator from taking a coaching position away from a current coach because he or she is not a professional educator.

365.title: Dedicating five percent of coal severance tax to the county of origin
365.description: The purpose of this bill is to dedicate five percent of the coal severance tax to the counties where the coal was located at time it was removed from the ground, upon which the coal severance tax is based. It provides that the five percent will go to the county commissions, and provides specific uses for the money.

366.title: Redistricting of the House of Delegates into one hundred single member districts
366.description: The purpose of this bill is to create one hundred single member districts after the 2010 census. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

367.title: Relating to the practice of beauty care
367.description: The purpose of this bill is to   require the board of Barbers and Cosmetologists to create a barber's apprentice program. The board may also license an applicant from another jurisdiction who completed an apprentice program.

368.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
368.title: Developing caseload standards for the Department of Health and Human Resource program areas
368.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Resources to propose rules for legislative approval on or before June 30, 2011, to establish caseload standards for the program areas within the department and to provide for periodic review of caseload standards; require caseload standards committees to comply with open meeting laws; clarify that employee representatives may serve an advisory role to a caseload standards committee; establish maximum staffing caseloads; provide that caseload standards be adopted using recognized standards for each program area; and provide that caseload standards may be used to justify budget requests.

369.title: Removing the Commissioner of the Bureau for Public Health from professional licensure boards
369.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove the Commissioner for the Bureau for Public Health from professional licensure boards.

370.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
370.title: Relating to the West Virginia Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA)
370.description: The purpose of this bill is to require implementation of the 1987 WV Occupational Safety and Health Act by requiring the development of standards and legislative rules by June 30, 2011. The bill repeals the WV OSHA Commission. Rule-making authority of the commission is transferred to the Commissioner of Labor who shall enforce the provisions of the act.

371.title: Prohibiting abusive behavior towards elephants by an owner or manager
371.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor for an owner or manager of an elephant to engage in abusive behavior towards the elephant. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

372.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
372.title: Prohibiting fractional pricing in the retail sale of gasoline
372.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit fractional pricing in the retail sale of gasoline and to define such pricing as an unfair or deceptive practice.

373.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
373.title: Providing standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs
373.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide standards for hospitals' charity care programs and bad debt collection programs and require hospitals to provide free charity care to uninsured citizens below poverty level and lowered rates to those citizens between one hundred and three hundred percent above poverty level.

374.title: Increasing the amount of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the board of risk management
374.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the limit of mine subsidence insurance reinsured by the Board of Risk Management from $75,000 to $125,000.

375.title: Relating to the Public Employees Retirement System and the Teachers Retirement System; and providing a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years
375.description: Relating to the Public Employees Retirement System and the Teachers Retirement System; and providing a one-time supplement for annuitants and survivor beneficiaries after being retired five consecutive years

377.title: Agreement among the states to elect the president by national popular vote
377.description: The purpose of this bill is to enter West Virginia into an interstate compact known as the Agreement Among the states to Elect the President by National Popular Vote. Under the compact, the state agrees to award its electoral votes to the presidential ticket that receives the most popular votes in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. The compact goes into effect when states cumulatively possessing a majority of the electoral votes have joined the compact.

378.title: Explaining all warranties for the sale of used cars including the requirements for "as is" sales
378.description: The purpose of this bill is to clearly explain all warranties for the sale of used cars including the requirements for "as is" sales.

379.title: Increasing the pay grade of cafeteria managers
379.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the pay grade of cafeteria managers.

380.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
380.title: Prohibiting the establishment of methadone treatment programs and clinics except those operated by comprehensive community mental health centers
380.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the Commissioner of Health shall prohibit the establishment of a new methadone treatment program or facility after July 1, 2011, except those established at comprehensive mental health centers.

381.title: Requiring witnesses of violent acts or emergency situations to report the incident to law-enforcement
381.description: The purpose of this bill is to require witnesses of violet acts against persons and emergency situations to report the incidents to the appropriate law-enforcement authorities.

382.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
382.title: Emergency Credentialing for Health Care Providers Act
382.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "Emergency Credentialing for Health Care Providers Act" which requires the Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Resources to establish a registry of emergency health care providers. It authorizes the secretary to designate all or a part of a health care facility or other location as an emergency health care center; authorizes the secretary to direct health care providers during emergencies; and requires emergency health care providers to comply with an emergency plan and credentialing plan. The bill provides that emergency health care providers and other health care providers who volunteer to perform emergency health care services without compensation are agents of the state for the purpose of any claims arising out of those services. And, the bill requires the secretary to promulgate legislative rules to implement provisions of this article.

383.title: Requiring the DHHR to provide matching funds for trust income disbursed to support autistic minors
383.description: This bill shall require the Department of Health and Human Resources to provide matching funds up to $2,000, dollar for dollar each calendar year, to any funds donated by the parents of a minor into a trust account created after the minor has been diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder, with the money from said trust to be disbursed to help pay expenses for the care of said minor and otherwise be exempt for state income tax purposes. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

384.title: Creating a board and fund to be used to maintain abandoned cemeteries
384.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a fund and board which will oversee the upkeep and beautification of cemeteries which have been abandoned by private corporations or people. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

385.title: Requiring the approval of board of health rules relating to tobacco use in public or private places
385.description: Requiring the approval of board of health rules relating to tobacco use in public or private places

386.title: Requiring county commissions to hold one monthly meeting in the evening
386.description: Requiring county commissions to hold one monthly meeting in the evening

387.title: Allowing the legal sale of liquor and wine on Sunday to be the same hours as prescribed for the sale of beer on Sunday
387.description: This bill shall allow the legal sale of liquor and wine on Sunday to be the same hours as prescribed for the sale of beer on Sunday.

388.title: Setting compensation standards for classified employees who work overtime on weekends or holidays
388.description: The purpose of this bill is to set compensation standards for classified employees who work overtime on weekends or holidays. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

389.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
389.title: Providing that all employees have the right to review and copy the contents of their personnel file
389.description: The purpose of this bill is to give all employees the right to review and copy their respective personnel files. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

390.title: Making it a misdemeanor to make more than three separate calls to 911 for nonemergency health concerns
390.description: The purpose of this bill is to make it a misdemeanor to make more than three separate calls to 911 for nonemergency health concerns.

391.title: Prohibiting gender discrimination in health care insurance plans
391.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit the use of the gender of insured persons as a rate-making factor for health insurance policies. These sections are new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

392.title: Providing that parties advocating passage or defeat of a public question by referendum vote are subject to reporting requirements
392.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that parties advocating passage or defeat of a public question by referendum vote are subject to reporting requirements of article eight, chapter three of the code.

393.title: Protecting academic speech of professional educators
393.description: The purpose of this bill is to protect academic speech of professional educators. These sections are new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

394.title: Clarifying an exception that allow sheriffs to collect property taxes in more than two installments
394.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify an exception that allow sheriffs, with the consent of the county commission, to collect property taxes in more than two installments.

395.title: Requiring review and approval of final settlements of Workers' Compensation awards
395.description: The purpose of this bill is to require review and approval of final settlements of Workers' Compensation awards.

396.title: Allowing a nonresident to have an additional ten days to pay his or her fine before the magistrate court sends notice to the DMV
396.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the time frames for courts to notify the Division of Motor Vehicles of defaults of payment and failures to appear of resident and nonresident persons who have motor vehicle violations in the state.

397.title: Creating the Spay Neuter Assistance Fund
397.description: This bill creates the Spay Neuter Assistance Fund.

398.title: Creating a commission to develop a pilot program to help at-risk youth in West Virginia
398.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a commission that will develop a pilot program to help at-risk youth in a selected county in West Virginia by introducing prevention strategies for children through early intervention and diversion strategies. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

399.title: Relating to granting licensed real estate appraisers access to commercial or residential review documents
399.description: The purpose of this bill is to grant licensed real estate appraisers access to commercial or residential review documents.

400.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
400.title: Renewable Portfolio Standards Sustainable Energy Act
400.description: The purpose of this bill is to phase in requirements for electric providers to add renewable energy systems to help protect and sustain the environment. This article is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

401.title: Redefining the term "public record" as it is used in the Freedom of Information Act
401.description: The purpose of this bill is to redefine the term "public record" as it is used in the Freedom of Information Act.

402.title: Establishing requirements for Marcellus gas well operations use of water resources
402.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish requirements for use of water resources at Marcellus gas well operations.

403.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
403.title: Relating to air pollution control
403.description: The purpose of this bill is to give the Director of the Department of Environmental Protection the authority to promulgate new vehicle emission standards. The bill creates the "Low Emission Vehicle Act."

404.title: Relating to corporate political accountability
404.description: The purpose of the bill is to require corporations that use corporate general treasury funds for political expenditures, to clearly report those expenditures to shareholders and further require shareholder authorize the use of corporate general treasury funds for political expenditures.

405.title: Relating to the designation of a primary guardian for a minor child
405.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the age at which a minor may nominate a guardian, from fourteen to sixteen and to expand the period of consideration regarding the parents' comparative caretaking and other parenting responsibilities.

406.title: Exempting antique motor vehicles from personal property taxes
406.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the value of antique motor vehicles for purposes of personal property taxes. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

407.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
407.title: Relating to treatment for drug and alcohol addiction
407.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a system of extended involuntary treatment for persons addicted to drugs and alcohol. Under the bill, only the parents, a close relative or a friend may file the petition for involuntary commitment. In addition, the petitioner is responsible for the payment of treatment costs. Currently, there is a procedure for involuntary commitment of a person who is addicted to alcohol and drugs, and as a result are a danger to self or others. Under that procedure, a person may be released without undergoing an effective and comprehensive drug and alcohol treatment program. This bill allows families to ensure that a family member will receive that involuntary extended drug and alcohol abuse treatment.

408.title: Making English the official language of West Virginia
408.description: The purpose of this bill is to make English the official state language. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

409.title: Prohibiting the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project for a living elected public official
409.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit  the naming of a publicly funded building, road, structure or project which receives any operating or construction moneys from state sources or state taxpayers for a living, elected official by any governmental entity. The bill also provides that any responsible governmental official authorizing the naming of a building, road, structure or project for a living elected official is liable to the governmental entity for any costs incurred by a violation. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

410.last_action: To House Veterans' Affairs and Homeland Security
410.title: Excluding disability income received from a veteran for service related injuries from any calculation used to determine spousal support
410.description: The purpose of this bill is to exclude disability income received by a veteran from the United States Department of Veterans' Affairs for service related injuries from any calculation used to determine spousal support.

411.title: Providing a one-time bonus payable in July of every year for retired public school teachers and state retirees
411.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a one-time bonus payable in July of every year starting in 2011 for retired public school teachers and state retirees.

412.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
412.title: Relating to the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"
412.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish the "Telephone Record Confidentiality Act"; to define terms; to prohibit any person from obtaining, selling or receiving a person's telephone record without their consent; and to provide criminal penalties.

413.title: Instituting a "Celebrate Freedom Week" and requiring the instruction in the study of the Declaration of Independence and other American historical documents
413.description: The purpose of this bill is to institute a "Celebrate Freedom Week" and require the instruction in the study of the Declaration of Independence and other founding American historical documents, including the Bill of Rights, during this week.

414.title: Relating to discounts at state parks for elderly and disabled persons
414.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the fifty percent reduction for campground rental fees for elderly and disabled persons at state parks is applicable throughout the year.

415.title: Requiring accident and sickness insurance providers and HMO's to cover the treatment of Lyme disease
415.description: The purpose of this bill is to require accident and sickness insurance providers and health maintenance organizations to cover certain Lyme Disease treatments. §33-15-4k, §33-16-3v and §33-25A-8j are new; therefore, they have been completely underscored.

416.title: Requiring write-in candidates for public office to pay a filing fee
416.description: The purpose of this bill is to require write-in candidates for public office to pay a filing fee for the office sought and to provide for distribution of the fee in the same manner as other candidates.

417.title: Prohibiting sex offenders from residing in certain areas and subjecting convicted sex offenders to global positional system monitoring
417.description: The purpose of this bill is to ensure the safety of the community by prohibiting sexual offenders from residing in certain areas and to subject persons convicted of sexual offenses against minors who are on parole or probation to global positioning system monitoring for the duration of their life.

418.title: Allowing private citizens the freedom to enter into private contracts for health care services or health care coverage or both
418.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow private citizens the freedom to enter into private contracts for health care services or health care coverage or both. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

419.title: Providing that the amount of required acreage for bird hunting preserves may be one hundred acres for privately owned commercial shooting preserves
419.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide that the amount of required acreage for bird hunting preserves may be one hundred acres for privately owned commercial shooting preserves.

420.title: Requiring a seventy-two hour waiting period before the Legislature votes on the state budget for final passage
420.description: Requiring a seventy-two hour waiting period before the Legislature votes on the state budget for final passage

421.last_action: To House Energy, Industry and Labor, Economic Development and Small Business
421.title: Creative Communities Development Act
421.description: The purpose of this bill is to develop a matching grant program to foster the development of creative communities in West Virginia. This article  is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.

422.title: Establishing the West Virginia Voluntary Employee Retirement Accounts Program
422.description: The purpose of this bill is to create the West Virginia Voluntary Employee Retirement Accounts Program, a voluntary tax- deferred retirement plan for nongovernmental employers and employees in the State of West Virginia who are without a retirement plan. Participation by employers and employees is voluntary. All federal requirements must be met before operations begin. A trust and an administration account are established. The bill provides for initial start-up and operations funding of $3 million from the Unclaimed Property Trust Fund, subject to appropriation, and provides for repayment of the amount. The Treasurer is authorized to collect fees from accounts for operations. The bill specifically provides that the state and the Treasurer are not liable for any losses or change in value. Information of a personal nature gathered for participation in the program is confidential and not subject to a Freedom of Information Act request.

423.title: Health Care Affordability Act
423.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide tax credits to those people paying for qualified medical expenses, or health insurance, or both medical expenses and health insurance. This section is new; therefore, it has been completely underscored.
